reviews.review_msg: He is really into SE Asia.  I learned a lot from his class and the cooking presentation was a lot of fun, it was a different experience from other courses.  He's a really nice person and is willing to help you out.  Just be patient with him because he does tend to be boring, but the second half of the semester gets better.

He is a great prof...can be kinda boring. His tests are hard thought....all memorization...It's crazy. He is really passionate about his work, which is why  you come away learning something new. Overall great prof take him of you have a good memory.

HE IS FREAKN BORING!!! His lectures makes no sense and he seems to like useless facts that are not related to the course.  His exams are so freakn hard and impossible to pass but it's a good thing he marks on a bell curve.  Nice guy with no personality.

Extremely distant individual who lectures, but does not provide room for discussion or feedback. I spent three months with him in the Southeast Asia field school and only learned that he is as boring overseas as he is on campus.
Worst professor I've had at SFU... lectures  make no sense and have no point, assignments a waste of time
approachable, likeable prof, encouraging more class input would help Dr. Howard.
